The freshness of the ingredients was excellent and the dressing was lovely.

I had the Chicken Marsala which was very tasty despite what tasted like canned mushrooms. My dining companions had the spaghetti and Chicken Piccata which were equally tasty. Portions were generous and preparation was expert.

The restaurant is small and intimate. The decor is bright and modern. The service is quick and friendly. Our waitress made very good suggestions.

We all agreed that we would like to eat here again.
The ambiance is nice the chicken piccata way too lemony and the sauce not so good .... the service was great ... might give it a second chance!
Excellent customer service and amazing food! Loved the chicken florentine soup! Will definitely come back.

First time we went had a pleasant experience for lunch...purchased a groupon on February 2nd and arrived with six adults...we called ahead, figuring they would be busy, but they wouldn't set a table aside...after waiting an hour and a half we came to the conclusion that they weren't going to seat us so we left....we came back tonight to give them a second chance to make things right....we called ahead nice again explaining what happened two weeks prior but again they would not accommodate us....we arrived and was greeted by a pleasant host at the door and was seated immediately, we told him what happened two weeks ago and he was very apologetic......a pleasant server took our drink orders....then the owner came out from back of the house and aggressively approached our table and was upset that we told his host that they didn't seat us the two weeks prior...that it wasn't his fault...and there was nothing he could do even though I mentioned to him we observed four 4 tops being seated even though they arrived after us...We once again left without being served......the owner is clearly inexperienced and unprofessional....he would have been better off keeping his mouth shut and allowing his pleasant server take care of business and we probably would have enjoyed our evening..,,but he wanted to make his point to us that our last visit was not his fault...and that we made him feel bad....well, I ask, who's fault was it??!! Mine??

Six of us ate here on March 13, 2018. If it were all about the food, I would have given a strong 4 or 5 stars because the food was delicious. However, the customer service was poor and very unsatisfactory. 

The waitress never cracked a smile and seemed unhappy to be there. Every time she brought us something we'd thank her and she would simply ignore the gesture; no "you're welcome" or even a "no problem".

The same waitress literally got into an argument with my mother over whether or not the menu stated there was pesto in the meal she chose. Instead of embracing a "customer is always right" service mentality, the waitress wanted to dig her heels in and prove she was right ("Want me to show you the menu again?").

I looked around and the other waitresses and staff looked as though they desperately wanted to be somewhere else as well. Where are the smiles? If you can't be happy, at least ACT happy for the customers.

Earlier in the evening, when we called to make reservations we had the following curt conversation:

Us: Yes, we'd like to make a dinner reservation for six.
Employee: High table or low?
Us: Excuse me?
Employee: High table or low?
Us: I don't understand what you mean.
Employee: Do you want a high table or low table?
Us: Um, we just want a table.

And so it went. Upon arrival, and throughout our visit, we were treated similarly. Customer service is a dying art - and this is on full display at the Twisted Italian.

Friends recommended Twisted Italian so we decided to give it a try.  We were immediately greeted by Marty who was extremely pleasant and he provided us with excellent customer service.  We ordered the Cardinale (white wine alfredo, sautéed onion and garlic, crushed red pepper tossed with penne pasta and a Pizza ( sausage, pepper and onions).  The food was delicious!  Overall it was a GREAT experience!
Super busy on a Friday night but the service was amazing and we cuddled up to the bar and enjoyed ourselves!

This was a random last minute decision to stop in here and we are glad we did! I have been driving past this restaurant for a while and for our anniversary since I work late and this is close to home, we stopped in for dinner. 

We were immediately greeted and seated right away. I loved the atmosphere and how quaint the place was. We both ordered some wine which was perfectly fine for my taste, I am not very picky when it comes to wine  We were also given some fresh bread and olive oil which I will always gladly nibble on until our food arrives. We were there on a spaghetti special night so my husband ordered the spaghetti with meatballs and I ordered the fettuccine alfredo with broccoli. We thought both were pretty great!

It wasn't anything that totally blew us away but it was excellent comfort food and I would absolutely come back to try more dishes on the menu. They seem to have some weekly specials that seem like an excellent deal so that is definitely worth a look.
Worth the wait! We had the Applewood smoked bacon bruschetta which was excellent. We had the spaghetti and meatballs for our main dish which was delicious!

This restaurant has the nicest and most attentive staff and the food is very good!! Today I had the calamari fra diavolo and my husband had the meatball sandwich. Both were excellent! The calamari is strips of a steak and not the rings, very tender and meaty. The meatballs are excellent and have an amazing flavor. We also had the Cesar's and they came fresh and the dressing is perfect. A++ highly recommend!!!
Good food, blah atmosphere. I loved the pasta, the sangria was tasty, and the service overall was decent. I'd go here again. They also almost always have coupons in the weekly mailers.

Had Spicy perogies which were good considering this is an Italian restaurant.  They wouldnt substitute a bun for sandwich sliced bread for the Italian Stack sandwich.  Then they gave me my wrong order.  When my order came I noticed they use MUSTARD on their Stromboli...also very strange.  The Italian beef they claim to be the best is no where close to the best. Im from Chicago and only Portillo's so far has the best beef in AZ.  The server was very uninformed about the menu.  Just not a pleasant experience and WILL NOT be returning.

Never again. A group of us went here for a friend's birthday & the service was horrible. The food was fine, but I wouldn't come back just because of the service. Our waitress got our waters in a semi-timely manner, but it all went downhill from there. She was very rude when we were ordering & when we asked anything. We even had to ask for our waters to be refilled. We tried to get her attention numerous times, but she just wasn't attentive enough to notice. Then, the birthday girl's husband went to discreetly ask for a small dessert to celebrate, the waiter that he asks comes over to the table & very NOT discreetly asks "So did you want a full cake or just a dessert?" fully w/in earshot of the birthday girl. Of course she knows she's going to get a dessert, but it could've been sort of a surprise, at least!  It's like the guy had never had a birthday table before. The last thing is one of our friends accidentally knocked over a glass of water onto the table and NO ONE, not one single employee in that restaurant, helped. No one came to give us more napkins or anything. We had to all chip in our own napkins as well as take some from other tables to soak up the water before it spilled all over the floor. Those napkins sat soaked on the table the rest of the night. The waitress dropped off the checks & didn't say anything about the napkins. We were all appalled at the service & won't ever be coming back.

Not sure what the one star person is talking about....we have been there 3 times recently and have been talked to immediately, seated immediately and asked if we wanted drinks or appetizers immediately. Our servers have been kind and helpful. The place is clean and well taken care of. We go to Twisted Italian because they have gluten free options. That is a HUGE help due to some our family having food allergy problems. Our portions have been generous and tasty. My only minor and I mean minor complaint is....the meat sauce could be less sweet and have a better quality meat put in it. I think it is sausage in there and I have gotten one or two pieces of gristle in mine. I like my sauce more on the savory side than sweet but that is a personal preference. We will be back and enjoy it just like the other times we have been there. Thank you Twisted Italian for considering gluten free folks!

We had the penne with meat sauce. Taste like something out of a can. Plus who ever heard of am Italian restaurant that doesn't have rigatoni. If u want mediocre food, this is the place for you. Sorry just not that good.

The food is amazing if they serve you the right plate, the service...... horrible. Came here for lunch on Saturday 3/10 walked in we were seated and then we waited...... and waited. Ordered drinks and waited some more. After about 35 min we finally ordered our food. The food came and looked amazing, tasted amazing. About 20-25 min after we got our food the waited came out and took my daughters plate away apparently they gave her the wrong pasta dish. So instead of just giving her the correct one or not charging us for her meal they took the dish away practically mid bite and gave her the right one . The food is amazing customer service not so much.

Good service. Calamari unremarkable. Good house wines. 

My group enjoyed citrus chicken salad. I liked eggplant chicken dish.

I love the fettuccine Alfredo here. It's creamy with the perfect amount of garlic flavor. I also love that it comes with broccoli and not chicken like most places. The portion sizes are huge. We've been here twice in the last week and both times we had great service.

Italian done right! The food is DELICIOUS!  The menu selections are not overwhelming.  The portions are pretty decent as well.  I always have leftovers to take home.  For me, italian food always seems to take even better as leftovers.  The staff is super friendly.  One of the owners even came over to greet me while waiting for my food.  They take extreme pride in their dishes and for good reason.
This is our go to for a salad in the neighborhood but everything on the menu is excellent, so far not 1 complaint from family or friends when we go here. Always good food.
Great Pizza and Chicken Parm!

Stopped in for a late lunch. I had the eggplant parmesan sandwich with garlic fries and salad with Italian dressing. Sandwich was way too big for me to finish. Not problem, lunch the next day! 
Hubby had the loaded Chicago Italian beef junior with garlic fries as well. The sandwich was huge. I can't imagine what the regular size would have been like! 
A small quaint, quiet restaurant. Two large screen TV's on opposite walls, but by no means a sports bar. Our waiter Shayne was terrific. Fast service and very personable. Food was absolutely delicious and brought to our table in a timely manner. Would definitely go back and recommend to family & friends.

The new owners have done a great job of livening the place up and making it obvious they care! I thought the prices were very reasonable and all of the staff very pleasant. The Italian Beef is so delicious that I had a hard time not getting one to go after splitting one at the restaurant. The Pierogies were so delicious I could have eaten 100. Looking forward to tasting the new brunch menu on the weekend. Exactly what the area needs. We will be back!

This was my 3rd visit in a year and the food and service have been consistently good. Pizza, pasta, chicken marsala, salads, meatballs, desserts have all been winners. The mozzarella garlic bread was disappointing this visit. It was toast slices with a large amount of dried oregano on top...weird. Otherwise a solid choice in this area. Saw they have started Sunday brunch with full bar.
Incredible place! Stoped in for lunch and had the Italian Beef sandwich..... yum! Salad w Italian beforehand was also great.  Highly recommend!!!!

First time there.  We read reviews and wanted to try the bread and oil but hubs ordered cheese bread so we assume the waiter thought that meant no regular bread. We never spoke up because then the food came!

Hubs got The italian beef sandwich and loved it.

Kids got meatball calzone and spaghetti special-okay but nothing spectacular.  I think we need to go back without kids and order something more unconventional.

I got caprese and it was yummy.

Hoping this can become our new Postino of the 85383. Going to go back and do bruschetta, and definitely brunch one of these Sundays.  

4 stars for mom and pop, extensive menu, patience for kids, potential, and wine and drinks menu:)

I went here for the first time with the $20 for $10 groupon deal.  The restarant is located next to Chipotle, Paradise Bakery, Cold Stone etc, and it's a modern Italian eatery.  Ordered calamari and it came as long satisfying pieces of squid and perfectly breaded.  I am a huge pesto fan, so for dinner I ordered the Mediterranean pasta with added chicken.  It was very good in both taste and portion size, mixed with sundried tomatoes, olives and feta cheese.  Bread basket was also good, although smaller in size than I am used to at other restaurants.  Host and waitresses were very friendly and service was fast.  It is not a fancy white cloth restaurant, but it is a eatery with good selection.  It can be pricy without a groupon, but they do have daily specials and weekend buy 1 get second pasta 1/2 off deals.  I would go back again!

Great local place for us to eat plus I like the app they have set up so it makes ordering for take out a breeze. Had a couple issues with forgotten food when we have done Uber delivery but they have always removed the charge without a fight like some places

I ordered the Mediterranean pasta and added shrimp. I'm very glad I did because the dish tasted excellent. 

I chose this because of a recommendation from a couple sitting next to me that I happened to see eating that same dish. I'm glad I took their advice. 

The pesto-Alfredo sauce was the highlight of the pasta creation. That, combined with the spaghetti noodles and feta cheese made a great flavor explosion! The kalamata olives added an extra salty taste that I didn't enjoy too much. I just don't like those type of olives.

I also sampled the cheesey bread with marinara sauce. The sauce tasted like it had been made from scratch. Highly recommended to order anything that includes that sauce. 

I will be visiting again to try more dishes!

EVERYTHING was fantastic from the decor to the excellent service Robert gave us to the delicious food to include fried mozzarella, calamari steak, lasagna, shrimp scampi, and chicken parmigiana. The huge glass of red sangria topped it all off! Just happened up on this fantastic place and can't wait to get back!

Came here yesterday in a pinch running behind for a movie.  The service was very accommodating.  Nothing like the other reviews described and in fact I would say it was a very classic service that made you feel at home.  I wish we were not in a rush, but we ordered and I got the alfredo which was pretty darn good.  The server said that it is all homemade and I had that feeling when we were eating.  My wife had the Mediterranean salad that looks really good...she said it was OK but not her favorite.  My son had spaghetti and I couldn't help myself so I gave that a try and it was not bad.  Its hard for me to like any other marinara besides my families.  The bread would have been great if it was hot so that was a little let down since it was so soft already.  We will go back for dinner since the lunch menu was very small and I would love to try their chicken marsala.

My husband and I are addicted to this place! The Chicken Caesar Sandwhich is to die for, even though it's not on the menu anymore.  But they'll still make it if you ask them.  It's awesome! Like a Joey Tribbioni level of Sandwhich perfection. If you need wi-Fi, sit on the side of the restaurant close to Dunkin Donuts so you can use theirs.  Lol.  My only beef is, does the TVs always have to be on sports? They're 4 TVs.... they don't all have to be on sports.

The food was average. The service was lacking. The waiter was dressed in a T-Shirt....  we paid $50 (not incl tip) for 2 entrees, 2 side salads, and an appetizer. No alcohol drinks. Another group came in that was obviously friends with the staff and they were loud and annoying. What compelled me to write this review, tho, is that I asked for mozzarella cheese on my entree in lieu of Parmesan and THEY CHARGED $2 FOR IT. Really?

Nothing disgusts me more than CHEAP. We will not go back and pay fairly high prices at a strip mall restaurant w/ a common atmosphere, not great service, and is so desperate to make a buck it has to charge a niggling and squeezy $2 for a cheese swap.... And not even a good quality mozzarella. Never Again.

After reading a few other reviews, if you think Olive Garden is good Italian, you prolly will think this place is good. But if you love Fabulous! Italian.....caveat emptor.

The ambiance is very nice.  Restaurant is clean and nicely decorated and appeared to be a bit more upscale than other restaurants in the area (there really isn't much to choose from out here).  Water was served in plastic "glasses" which seemed a little strange to me for such an upscale place.  We both ordered the Twisted Merlot wine and when it came to us, it was COLD!  I have never been served Merlot that was obviously being kept in the cooler.  It is a really big No-No to serve Merlot in any other way than room temperature.  Why don't they know this?  The bread was very dry and cool.  It may have tasted better if it had been warmed.  I had a house salad that was served with a very sweet dressing that I guess just comes with it as I wasn't given a choice of dressings by the waitress.   My husband had the caesar salad that was "okay".  I ordered the Sorrentino which was very tasty and a lot more food than I could eat and my husband had the Chicken Marsala which he said was "okay".  We wanted to give this place a try as it is very close to where we live, but if we want really good Italian food, we will travel much farther to get it.

Been wanting to try this place out for a while and finally made it over there a few weeks back. We split the South of the Border Pierogis, Caesar salad and Twisted Ravioli. All were quite delicious and I was pleasantly surprised by how tasty the pierogis were. The sangria was also pretty spot on as well. I will definitely return!

I took my daughter her for lunch one day.  Food was not fresh nor home made.  Flavor was bland and uninteresting.  Presentation was lacking any kind of imagination (fettuccine alfredo on a white ceramics - I thought I was looking at a snow storm in a bowl).  Bread was like what comes out of pillsbury tubes that you get a super market - no substance or texture.  Just white fluff.  Disappointed.
Great Italian food!! The lasagna is very authentic tasting!! We have found our new favorite neighborhood restaurant. Loved the atmosphere and staff.

For a small business to survive around corporate places says a lot.  On the flip side, it's crappy corporation restaurants so, they have the upper hand.  

The service was decent and the food was pretty good.  Each of our party had something different and the only complaint was that the Brochette was average.   It wasn't bad but, it wasn't great.  It wasn't traditional and the added sweetness didn't work for me.  Personal preference.

Experienced Twisted Italian for the first time last night with my girlfriends. Joey our server was top notch and had a fabulous personality. She navigated us through the menu and made excellent recommendations.  Enjoyed the experience and will definitely be back in the near future.

Came here for the first time with my cousin to have dinner.  The moment we walked in we were greeted by an older gentleman who sat us right away.  The server came by, it was a woman with long brown hair. She took our drink order and gave us a few minutes to look over the menu.  

The atmosphere was great, except for the constant flickering of the track lighting (it was quite distracting).  The server had a couple of other tables and for the most part did an okay job.  She came by and we placed our order. 

We got our calamari first, and honestly it was bad.  I felt like I had ordered fish sticks that we're taken out of the microwave.  I was so hungry that I ate a stick but my stomach could not bear another piece.  We asked for a bread basket.  When it arrived the so called vinegar and oil dip, was mainly oil and a penny size drop of vinegar.  The food came out pretty quick, but I wish it hadn't.  I got the penne Alfredo with chicken and broccoli.  I could only take one bite. It was rubbery and tasted like sewer water.  

I was so upset but I did not want to complain.  I love family owned businesses because I know how hard it is to survive in such a tough industry. Although my server did not even ask why I did not touch my food.  She came by gave us the bill and asked if I needed a box.  She seemed so robotic and cold.  I told her yes and we paid for our food.  I was so disappointed that I even left my food there. 

Thank God for the bread basket.

I'm only giving this place two stars because I used to love it. I moved in the area about a year ago. That was the first Time I tried this place. It was awesome! It was my new Italian joint. So we would go there at least once a month.  When I stated school everything got busy do I couldn't go as often. I missed their mozzarella sticks so we went back. I don't know if they got new management or their standards have dropped but everything we got was way too overcooked.  The mozzarella sticks were so burned the cheese was leaking out of them. Also the dish I got had red sauce which tasted like it was straight from the can. I'm sad I used to love this place but I haven't been back there since this happened 2 months ago.

We just did take out and I got the combo beef and sausage sandwich and it was easily the best sandwich I have had in Arizona. It was delicious. Got the pierogies too and they were very good. This was our second time eating here and will definitely be back.

Yum Yum Yum. Bread and oil was delish. I had the twisted ravioli - fabulous! Other diners with us had spaghetti with sausage, penne, and meatball sandwich. We are all very pleased with our dishes and would go back. I thought it was much better than the typical run of the mill Olive Garden. We did have a groupon but they also have deals which make it a little more reasonable.

Decided to give this place a second chance after a poor experience the first time of slow service. This time my experience was even worse. I'm not one to give reviews, however my wife and I wanted to go somewhere local for a quick dinner without the kids and were greatly disappointed. When we arrived we were seated promptly by a friendly hostess. Positive and the only reason there is a star. Then we got drinks, ordered an appetizer and our entrees and told by server that she would be back with bread..... 45 mins later our drinks were empty, no bread, no appetizer, no food, no sign of server. Once she came back to table she apologized and asked what it was that we had ordered......what?!!!? We were told that there was an issue in the kitchen and she didn't see our order...AKA she never rang it in and we were completely forgot about. As we told her we had to leave to pick our kids back up and wouldn't have time to reorder and wait another 45mins to eat, she offered us a gift certificate. Valued at $25.... which is a little bit of a joke since there is no way 2 people could eat there for even close to $25.  2nd try and We will not be back. Fool me once, fool me twice....never again.

Wow! We have driven by this place plenty of times but never stopped in. The food was, to say the least, very impressive for a strip mall restaurant.
My wife tried the chicken piccata, it was very fresh, flavorful and tender.
I had the Penne pepperonata. It was very good, lots of flavor and a good sized portion (I had to take about 1/3 of it home and I'm not exactly a small man).
The waiter was very pleasant and attentive, we will most definitely return and also recommend it to friends.
Been coming here for years and I am pleased with the owners and the food here they always accommodate our low carb lifestyle!

We have been going to Twisted for sometime and always love their food. We ate there last night and had the sausage/pepperoni calzone and it was delicious.  We also tried the sausage sliders and were amazed at how delicious they are!  Raised in NY and being Italian, I love good Italian food and Twisted did not disappoint.

A little Italian gem in the midst of many chain restaurants.  For some reason there were almost no people eating when we were there around 1 pm on a Thursday but the food was great. I had the pear Gorgonzola salad with grilled chicken which was perfectly fresh and tasty. My hubby had the pene cardinal with Italian sausage...also delish.  We finished it off with a very fresh cannoli . They had to have made is fresh right then and there. We will definitely go back. We were sorry that more people seemed to be going to bland chain restaurants instead of choosing this one.
The food was surprisingly fresh tasting and the service was impeccable.  The prices were a little high for what you get but all in all a great experience we will be back for sure.
Very nice modern little place. Clean and tidy. Ceasar Salad was great, service was a bot odd with the cook seating is. But from the looks of it they don't get much lunch business. Will be back

Super great food. Seated our large group of 10 very quickly. Spaghetti With meat sauce was the best I've ever had and I love spaghetti.  All the staff are friendly and prompt in their service.  Good job. 2nd visit with more to come.

The best service with the best gluten free crust in 25 miles!!! Thanks Alex for the smile and great service even through the dinner rush on a Friday.  Also the gluten free pasta is excellent. The fettuccini, raviolis, and sauces are great.

I brought my family back to Twisted Italian after a not so great first experience.(read my first review from 11/2011.)
We went back during the Christmas season in December. it was busy and was a marked difference from the first time. The wait staff was attentive, knowledgable, and pleasant. The owner came by and was also friendly. The food was very good and my three girls (twins 7 and older 10) loved the alfredo sauce. I think it's notable for an owner to take the critiscism and be thankful for what's written on Yelp (The good & Bad) because Yelp allows people to be more honest.  Every customer will tell you to your face that they loved their experience -- but, will dish the dirt on Yelp.  Bravo to the ownership of Twisted Italian. We'll come back again.

This is the first time we tried this place having recently moved into the area.  We thought it was fantastic.  My wife had the lasagna which was outstanding.  The order was large enough for two or more people.  I had the Chicken Parmesan and again, it was a large portion and just excellent.  Salads were great as was the service.  It was Wednesday night and the added treat was all bottles of wine were 1/2 price!  We got there about 7:00 pm and were immediately seated at the one last tables. The place ended up being packed with many people waiting so I guess it is known in the area to be good.  Highly recommended.
Was turned away for a party of 5 because we just wanted drinks and appetizers. Second attempt of going the first was unfriendly toward my one year child. Owner is very impersonable.

Really good for a quaint little Italian restaurant. There are not a lot of quaint restaurants outside of your "run o' the mill" chain restaurants that I'm desperately sick of. Had lunch there, want to be back for their happy hour. I got the Mediterranean salad and it was better than Oreganos.  Perfect little place to get some good lunch for a decent price on a Saturday.

I was lookin forward to a spaghetti plate done well for a while now.

I don't need fastidious rituals or opulent trappings. Just the reward of terrific food, distinguished by first-rate ingredients. That is exactly what I got, classic garlic pasta with meat sauce 8.95. A Moretti Italian Lager 4.5 Cheesecake 6.

I have to admit a phony accent might have been cool but no matter, my pleasure was intact.
Restaurant was clean which is the most important. I could see into the kitchen from my seat and it was clean as well. Service was average. In my opinion the food was below average. Price was fair.

Went here one time as I am new to the area. It was just ok - so MANY other real Italian places that blow this out of the water.  Best description of their food is "forgettable" and overpriced.  The restaurant is really small too!  I Would rather drive out of the area to get much better food.
Great food! Stopped in for lunch, had several things and shared. The owner was super nice and visited with us for a while. Highly recommend!

Great food! Great staff! My boyfriend and I unknowingly came in like 30 min from close, we realized this and got up to go and the server and bartender assured us that it was fine, and to stay. So glad we did! The perogies were excellent, pasta, excellent, and the wine pairing suggestion was perfect.  We did eat quickly so as not to keep them too long, but we were both very happy with our meal and service, especially so close to closing, very professional.

My daughter chose italian for dinner tonight and for that she gets the mvp.  The food and service were top notch.  Spinach artichoke dip was amazing and we couldn't stop eating it.  All four of our entrees were excellent.  Our server was efficient and had great personality.

We can't wait to go back but we have to wait until we aren't so stuffed!
I've been to this place several times the happy hour can't be beat great specials great service the owner cares about the food that he serves I highly recommend it

Pleasantly surprised.  Wife and I along with our 6 year old daughter visited there one early afternoon during  the week. Place was void of anyone except the host. I expected bad food because of the time and thinking Chef wasn't ready but it was great.  Pretty good atmosphere as I prefer more private booths but it was nice.  3 visits here and food is above average and service pretty decent. I hope you support these smaller places as it's tough nowadays.

My husband and I dined at the Twisted Italian this evening with a Groupn and we were pleasantly surprised. The server (Katie) was very friendly and attentive. Food was hot and arrived promptly. I had the eggplant Parmesan and my husband had the cheese ravioli with meat sauce. Both were excellent.  We will definitely be back!

The service was poor...waiter forgot we were even there for a good period of time. The menu was very limited and typical of a run-of-the-mill Italian restaurant. It took about 30 minutes to even get the food! Once arrived, the food was bland and could have been made better at home (ie. pizza had too much sauce and the toppings fell right off the crust, the pasta was under sauced, the Caesar salad was standard...hard to mess it up) 
Raspberry tea was actually just Brisk sugar water that they didn't explain. Bread was additional cost and it wasn't worth the extra $.

Overall, poor experience and will not go back. It was an intriguing name, until we realized the focus is in the wine (a product they don't make) instead of the service and food. We like to support local, but too many cons to consider again.

Save some time and go to Babbo!

A group of four adults and a toddler went for lunch. We were one of 2 or 3 tables dining in the place and the wait time to get our food was really long. I ordered the prosciutto and spinach grilled cheese, which came with no prosciutto. Despite that, the first few bites tasted pretty good, but then all I could taste was garlic. One person in our group ordered the entree sized Chicken Parmesan and it was a surprisingly small portion. My drink was never refilled and we had to ask another waitress if we could get our check and a few boxes. Our waitress came with boxes, but still no check. She didn't even mention the check. The restaurant still wasn't busy. My husband had to walk up to the bar area to pay so we could leave. We were not impressed and probably won't be return customers.

This place needs a lot of work. How about training your wait staff? We came in, and had to ask for bread (all other tables had it), then had to ask for balsamic (all other tables had it), then waited while the waiter randomly refilled drinks but forgot tables like ours.  Our appetiser, the Caprese salad, was bland, with under-ripe tomatoes. The main dishes we had (mine was pesto primavera) were just so-so. My friend's small pizza was nothing special and Barro's Pizza does a better job. The only bright side of this was the dish another friend ordered, the chicken fettuchini - the chicken was really great, although someone needs to teach the cook how to prepare noodles. I hope this place has some better luck, but so far it's just a waste of your time while they figure out how to train their waiters and their cooks.

I have to go up this way for work sometimes and I drive by A LOT. I finally stopped in during lunch. It was awkward being the only one in there. I am italain american and I have had some AMAZING italian food in my day! I would say this was good but, not  I HAVE TO GO BACK!!! A little pricey too especially for lunch... But, I did enjoy myself.

We had the thin crust Hawaiian pizza and parmesan fries food was great. Good ingredients. The vibe of the restaurant was odd and original. Cross between a wine bar and a family restaurant. Customer service was great.

OK everyplace screws up an order once in a while but only a great restaurant before that provides superb customer service when they do mess up. I would highly recommend them for great food is superb service
I love this neighborhood restaurant!  Great food and atmosphere. The chicken parm is delicious - a must try!

This place is so amazing! I have been here 10 or more times and gotten different items on the menu and have never had anything bad. The waiters are kind and helpful and the place just feels cozy. Highly recommend.
We were there for the first time on Saturday and were pleasantly surprised. The garlic fries are to die for. Would definitely recommend this restaurant.

Food was good bit the waitress was not friendly at all but she loved the regulars didn't want to be bother asked her for something and it was almost like how dare we bother her I wanted a dessert  it I guess she didn't want me to she just left the check and took off but once that money was down she couldn't wait. Then she didn't even ask if I wanted grated cheese on my pasta she just did it. Good thing there was another waiter or I wouldn't have had another refill on my drink. When we were already outside the restaurant the male owner or manager yells out have a nice evening how about ask us how our meal was instead 5mins ago. Like I said it's a good thing I like their pasta

So far, I've only been here for lunch, but it's the best lunch spot I've found in this area.  

The wife (M) and I had the chicken pesto sandwich and a wrap the last time we were in, both of which were really good, and this time we were looking for salads. We both wound up with the chicken caesar and the cream of chicken florentine soup.  I told M that the next time I'm sick, she has to come back here and buy a bucket of the soup.  It may be the best soup I've ever had.  

The staff has been very friendly and helpful. The atmosphere is very comfortable and inviting.  The food is excellent. It's not a place designed to get you in and out as fast as possible, so if you're in a hurry to get back from lunch, just let them known and they'll make sure that you get done and out in a reasonable time.

What a pleasant environment with great employees. The food is great and is reasonably priced.  We recently ordered catering for our daughters graduation and they again did not disappoint. Although I don't want to share this little secret, its important for others to expierence this great place.

My husband and I went for the first time on a Saturday night.  We were hoping to experience a new, local Italian restaurant that would be closer than the one we usually go to.  First off, our server was very friendly and helpful.  She was attentive to our needs throughout the meal.  No problems there.  She brought us our requested water with lemon.   I have never tasted such bad water in a restaurant.  Like right from the tap.  We ordered a Garden Fresh Salad, which the menu said was made with Romaine lettuce, etc.  Ours came with what appeared to be iceberg lettuce.  BORING!!!   The bread that was served was really skimpy, only 3 very small pieces.  Nothing special.  I had the Mediterranean Pasta.  Flavor was "ok".  A bit overpriced at $10.50.  My husband had the Penne Pepperonata.  He felt it was also just "ok" and overpriced as well @ $11.75.  We did, however, get a buy one entree' get one for 1/2 price.  So at least that was some consolation.  Simply stated...we will likely not be returning for a second time.

Thought we would try it again with the new ownership.

The worst. Overpriced, nothing but old people in there, and my stomach has yet to recover.

Never going back.
This was the best chicken piccata I've ever had. Nice little place and great service!

Average is about best, nothing special.  Food was average, prices seemed high for what we got. Service was a little slow. Loud and small restaurant. Has a kids menu but drinks for kids come in adult size cups. The staff was very friendly and attentive. We will probably try again.

I do not remember last time I got such bad service! We went for lunch with the entire family! It was past 2:00 pm and they said they have happy hour! The menu said all specialty cocktails are $2 off. I choose one from the menu and I was told that, that particular one was not on happy hour, although was on the same menu as the rest! So I asked again how come they are all $2 off except the one I wanted! I was told in a rude voice that yes, that was the case. Megan who was our waitress started to argue with me and at the end said, fine, if you want $2 off I'll give you $2 off. Needless to say I did not order anything, I just stuck with the water.  She had an attitude the rest of the lunch! I have no idea how this restaurant is still in business! We will not be going again!
We stumbled upon this place and loved it. The lasagna is excellent. The place and staff have real character. Already been back 3 times.  The lunch specials are very reasonable.

My wife and I decided to give the place a try since we moved up this way back in March. We were seated right away. The server was friendly and prompt. The food was good and generous portions. The food was a little overpriced but it seems that a lot of places have raised their prices as well. We're going to try to include this place into our regular dining out rotation for sure.
won't be going back... food was mediocre at best.  it is NOT kid-friendly.

first time there and they were great!  Took my order just before closing and that was very nice of them alot of places just say" we are closing"

I will return again and dine in next time.... thank you Twisted  Italian!

I was in tonight with my husband tonight shane was our waiter he suggested we get the Italian beef sandwiches we absolutely loved them! Food was amazing andshane was very attentive. Will definitely be back and recommend to friends and family.

I normally don't leave reviews, however I was very disappointed with everything. The food was mediocre, service was horrible! I ordered a sangria, could of kept drinking, however our waitress never bothered to come back and check in on us. We only saw her when we places our order, and brought our food. In such a lovely afternoon, it was a waste of our day!
Will not be doing this again.

Overall the service was excellent.  Really nice and friendly with great service.  They called me by name multiple times, etc.  we had the egplant parmasean and the penne alfredo.  The eggplant parm didnt have much for flavor and left a bad taste. It was actually pretty bad tasting and my wife threw it away.  Alfredo at most places is hit or miss, and it was better then most mom and pop places.  Most are super watery and not worth it.  Their's was a really good consistency, but didnt have a ton of flavor, and had a hint of country grave flavor (pepper i assume).  The location is great for our area, and the establishment is really nice with tv's etc.  just wasnt super impressed with the food.  We also tried the mozzarella garlic bread. The dipping sauce was good but the bread was not.
